title: BBC Local Live: Coventry and Warwickshire on Friday 16 June 2017 - BBC News

lorry driver cleared over cyclist death .
home of the bears breaks attendance record .
the pooch that answers only to polish .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we will back from 08:00 on monday with more news , sport , travel and weather .
enjoy the weekend .

documents.title: the pooch that answers only to polish
text: the pooch that answers only to polish

documents.title: the charity worker providing aid to grenfell tower victims
text: a coventry man who 's been volunteering at the site of the grenfell tower tragedy described the scenes when he first arrived as being like `` something out of war-torn syria '' .

haroon mota , who 's a fundraising manager for penny appeal , a uk-based international humanitarian aid provider , said he and his team of volunteers have been offering food , drink and emotional support to the hundreds of people affected .
`` these people have lost their homes and their livelihoods , their homes and their belongings but they 're just so thankful and grateful , '' he said .
`` we 're just trying to do whatever we can . ''
the observation of ramadan , he said , was making it difficult for some muslim residents who were `` having to go 19 hours through the day without eating or drinking '' .
he said : `` but we provided a hot meal for over 500 people yesterday alone . ''
a crazy long day ended with @ twitterid providing # iftar/meal for over 500 people inc families effected @ twitterid # grenfelltower
helping others in need is the simplest way to guarantee that allah will help you at your own time of need .
gud job brother & team
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : scorchio
text: we 're forecast a hot weekend and a muggy night tonight .
temperatures could reach as high as 27c ( 81f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in coleshill collision
text: a motorcyclist has died after a collision involving a van on coleshill industrial estate , says the ambulance service .
paramedic officers performed cpr on the injured man at the scene , but he was confirmed dead a short time after 12:30 today .
the driver of the van , a man in his 20s , did n't require hospital treatment .
station road and gorsey lane remain closed by police .

documents.title: car transporter driver sentenced for killing young stratford mum rachael martin
text: on our front page this week : a car transporter driver killed a young stratford mother as she selflessly went in front of his vehicle to save the life of one of her young daughters , who was also severely injured .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: yoga and tai chi can change our bodies at 'molecular level ' says researcher
text: mind-body interventions ( mbis ) such as yoga and mindfulness do n't simply relax us , they can `` reverse '' the effect of stress at a molecular level , says a coventry university academic .

lead investigator ivana buric from university 's centre for psychology , behaviour and achievement said millions around the world enjoyed the benefits of mbis , but perhaps did n't realise they can change the way our `` genetic code goes about its business '' .
she said : more needs to be done to understand these effects in greater depth , for example how they compare with other healthy interventions like exercise or nutrition . ''

documents.title: student blocks to be reviewed after grenfell tower fire
text: one of coventry 's largest student accommodation providers study inn says it 'll be reviewing designs of its blocks to check whether they can make improvements in light of the grenfell tower fire .
the company says it will work with architects , installers and external fire consultants to check whether there is anything to be done to the buildings .

looking to reassure residents in its tallest block in the city , the ex-axa building , it confirms that the structure has no cladding and is , instead , made up of glass panels , aluminium windows and concrete .
all of our buildings have been through the building regulation approval process which includes consultation with the fire authority and production of a fire risk assessment .
all of this is completed before the building comes into occupation and is then reviewed annually . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: people urged to 'think before they act ' on night out following tragic death
text: police have urged people on a night out to think before they act in the wake of robert bavington 's tragic death .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: coventry to host blackburn rovers in carabao cup
text: the sky blues will face tony mowbray 's blackburn rovers at the ricoh arena in the first round of the carabao cup - otherwise known as the league cup .
the tie will be played in the week commencing 7 august .
# carabaocup : round one draw @ coventry city v @ twitterid

@ twitterid i got my boy x
mowbray relegation derby cup # pusb
well take that draw # ccfc # pusb

documents.title: cctv images released after stratford robbery
text: cigarettes and a wallet were stolen during a burglary in stratford-upon-avon on saturday 1 april , police say .
they 've issued cctv of a man with a tattooed hand they wish to identify in connection with their investigation into the incident at the co-op store on wordsworth avenue .

documents.title: undercover cops seize £ 2,000 worth of crack cocaine and heroin in nuneaton
text: under-cover officers swooped on a sus man in nuneaton and found crack cocaine and heroin worth £ 2,000 .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: launchbury and hughes start for england against argentina
text: wasps skipper joe launchbury and the club 's nathan hughes both start for england in the final test against argentina tomorrow .
front row matt mullan is one of the replacements for the match in santa fe .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: warwickshire revealed as retail fraud hotspot by which ?
text: research by consumer watchdog which ?
shows warwickshire is a hotspot for retail fraud , with 30,944 cases reported between 2014 and 2016 .
the analysis of data from uk cyber-crime centre action fraud found there were 15.7 reports per 10,000 people , compared with the average of 3.4 .
the group is calling on the government to do more to tackle the problem .
you can use this interactive map to find out the most commonly occurring fraud where you live .

documents.title: anniversary of reconciliation statue
text: events are taking place to mark the 40th anniversary of bradford 's reconciliation statue , copies of which spread a message of peace across the world including coventry .
the one in the city has been in the cathedral ruins since 1995 when sir richard branson donated it to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of the second world war .
copies can also be found in the hiroshima peace park in japan , stormont castle in belfast and another in germany as part of the berlin wall memorial .
international visitors will visit coventry today for a service dedicated to the 40-year-old piece .

documents.title: meet the pooch that answers only to polish
text: sit , stay , heel , fetch , walkies - what do you do when the dog in your care just does n't want to listen ?
that was the problem staff at kenilworth 's dogs trust thought they were facing when it seemed they 'd been landed with a disobedient dog that could not adjust to kennel life .
but german shepherd caleb was not a little worse for wear so much as a little warsaw - he had once had polish owners and it gave staff a theory to test .

the trust said a polish speaker who was adopting another dog was asked to speak to caleb who `` within seconds '' began to relax at the sound of the language , then `` perform a repertoire of tricks with ease '' .
the trust now hopes a polish-speaker will adopt the four year old .

documents.title: question time : coventry audience grills minister over may 's tower visit
text: the prime minister should have met residents of grenfell tower despite the likelihood of being shouted at , a former tory cabinet minister has said .
michael portillo , a former mp for kensington where the fire happened , told the bbc mrs may `` did n't use her humanity '' when she visited the scene .
when asked by a member of the bbc question time audience at coventry university last night , defence minister tobias ellwood suggested she had not met residents for `` security concerns '' .
this audience member says that he would not vote for the tories again under the leadership of theresa may # bbcqt
i 'd rather vote for tm and prevent that fool hardy gang of 4 into # 10 .
what a mess jc , da , jmcd and that idiot et would leave .
more debt
yeah cos the current ones are making such a success of everything # strongandstable
i 'm not a tory , & i 'm not leaving my children with huge debt to pay when i 'm gone .
it is delusional to think we can borrow r way out of debt
it 's not actually .
but you wo n't have anything to leave your kids anyway if you have to pay for your social care .

her heart and where she places her value .

documents.title: carabao cup draw
text: the sky blues are unseeded when they go into the draw for the first round of the carabao cup this afternoon .
they could end up facing the likes of sunderland , leeds , derby or nottingham forest in the competiton , formerly known as the efl cup .
the carabao cup ?
get used to it .
it will be a major part of the 2017-18 football season .
why should we `` get used to it '' - we call it the league cup ( and it is n't a major part of anything )
if that crappy cup gets any worse the beeb will be able to afford to show it

sounds like one of those old mates cartel .
for fuck sake
do n't tell me what to do
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: midlands housing group reassures residents
text: one of the region 's largest social housing providers is reassuring its tenants that fire safety checks are carried out annually in its tower blocks .
the wm housing group owns 38 high rises in coventry and birmingham .
it says it 's double-checked records and none of its buildings have cladding like the type used in grenfell tower in west london , where at least seventeen people were killed in a fire .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: kelly-evans signs new coventry contract
text: kelly-evans signs new coventry contract

documents.title: long-delayed brownsover surgery approved , to open in summer 2018
text: campaigners are celebrating after a new gp surgery in brownsover was finally approved .
author: Rugby & Lutterworth Observer

documents.title: cricket semi-final beaks edgbaston attendance record
text: edgbaston cricket ground hosted a semi-final of the champions trophy yesterday .
the venue 's one day international attendance record was broken , with 24,340 turning up to see india beat bangladesh .
we 've broken another odi attendance record !
thank you to all the fans that attended today 's @ twitterid match between bangladesh and india .
# ct17

documents.title: man charged with nuneaton sex offences
text: a man is due to appear at warwickshire magistrates court today charged with six counts of sexual assault , police say .
the alleged offences occured in nuneaton between 4 may and 14 june 2017 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: lorry driver cleared of causing cyclist 's death
text: a lorry driver involved in a crash that killed a cyclist has been cleared of causing her death .
magda tadaj , 25 , died when a lorry hit her in croydon in may 2016 and she was dragged under its wheels for 14 metres .
the old bailey jury cleared darren anderton , 49 , of acacia road , nuneaton , of causing death by careless driving .
the jury heard ms tadaj had `` catastrophic injuries '' .

documents.title: council issues apology for pool opening delay
text: a delay in opening the paddling pools at st nicholas park and victoria park in leamington spa is due to a change in contract arrangements , says warwick district council .
it has issued an apology for any inconvenience or disappointment caused .
the pools are due to open daily from tomorrow until `` early september '' .
the paddling pools at st nick 's park & victoria park will be open daily from sat 17 june until early september # loveyourparks .

documents.title: cyber attack forced nuneaton hospital shutdown of 1,500 computers
text: technology staff at nuneaton 's hospital had to painstakingly hand check 1,500 desk top computers in the wake of the cyber attack which crippled its system .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: meditation and yoga can 'reverse ' stress reactions , study suggests
text: a study carried out by coventry university has shown that exercises like yoga and tai chi can reverse reactions in dna which cause ill health and depression .
the research , published in the journal frontiers in immunology , reviews a decade of studies working with more than 800 people .
experts claim those people who meditate show better mental and physical health over a period of time .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: some bright and some cloudy times today , with the potential for sunny spells at times and top temperatures of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry newsroom .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
let us know what is going on in your area or send us your photos .
you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: stratford-upon-avon library to reopen
text: stratford-upon-avon 's refurbished library on henley street will open to the public on 12 july , says warwickshire county council .
the building will also house the registration service , eventually hosting weddings in a brand new ceremony room for up to 35 guests .

documents.title: police plea to help find missing mum and daughter from coventry
text: police are trying to find a mother and daughter who have been missing from their home in coventry since monday .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: police seize over £ 22,000 on motorway
text: warwickshire police have been awarded £ 22,800 after seizing cash from a driver who failed to pull over for them on the a5 near crick .
a 27-year-old was arrested on sus of money laundering after being pulled over on the motorway on 12 may when police found the cash stashed in a plastic bag .
he was later released under investigation but , at a hearing on monday , leamington magistrates ordered the confiscation of the cash , determining it was intended for use in crime .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after some evening sunshine it will stay dry tonight , with clear spells developing .
the winds will ease but it will feel cooler than recent nights - lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: two taken to hospital after a5 crash
text: two people were taken to hospital after a car collided with a motorbike on the a5 this morning , the ambulance service says .
they were called to the scene , near the rugby truck stop at crick , at around 07:40 .
the motorway was closed in both directions for a time , but has since re-opened .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: three in court over mark nesmith murder
text: two men have appeared at coventry magistrates charged over the fatal stabbing of a tattoo artist .
mark nesmith , 35 , died in hospital after being found injured at a bp garage in the butts , coventry , on sunday .

uzair hussain , 24 from crampers field radford and 18-year-old sebastian vastaki-barsby from barkers butts lane in coundon were arrested on wednesday morning and have been committed to appear at warwick crown court tomorrow .
tyler smith , from attoxhall road , coventry , appeared at warwick crown court today and will next appear on 14 july .

documents.title: council to consult on future of children 's centres
text: a `` redesign '' of its 39 children 's centres is being proposed by warwickshire county council .
under the plans 12 centres for 0-5-year-olds would be turned into `` family hubs '' offering a `` broader range of services '' for 0 -19-year-olds .

but the future of the remaining the 27 centres is uncertain - the council says it will `` explore any opportunities within the local community and providers to continue to offer services '' at these centres .
the council says it 's changing the way it does things because it needs to make £ 67m of overall savings by 2020 .
today the cabinet will agree the language of a consultation document to go out to the public for 11 weeks on the 26 june , prior to a final recommendation agreed at cabinet in october june 2017 .
it is expected that the changes will start coming into effect from april 2018 .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: delia derbyshire 's plaque unveiled
text: dr who actors colin baker and nicola bryant joined bbc coventry & warwickshire 's vic minett to officially unveil a blue plaque to celebrate bbc radiophonic workshop musician delia derbyshire .
the electronic music pioneer who co-created the dr who theme song has been memorialised at her childhood home in coventry .
delia derbyshire 's blue plaque unveiled on # bbcmusicday
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: youth club gets £ 300k national lottery funding
text: a huge funding grant means a youth club in leamington can keep running .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: housing provider confirms no cladding similar to grenfell tower used
text: whitefriars says they 've double-checked records and have confirmed none of their tower blocks in coventry have cladding of the type used at grenfell tower .
our records show that in all of our properties two types have been used .
in the majority of cases the cladding we have used has been 'rockwool ' or other mineral fibre .
this has the highest level of fire safety available and is not flammable .
the other type of material used is phenolic resin which has a similarly high two-hour fire resistance .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overturned vehicle on m40
text: a vehicle has overturned on the m40 northbound closing one lane between j12 b4451 ( gaydon ) and j13 a452 ( bishop 's tatchbrook ) .
lane 3 closed # m40 n/b between j13 and j14 due to a collision involving an overturned vehicle .
pls pass with care .
traffic officers making
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: warwickshire 's fire service to work with councils after grenfell tower fire
text: warwickshire fire and rescue say they 'll be working closely with local authorities and landlords of high rise properties across the county `` to ensure that they are legal and compliant '' .

reassuring residents , following the major fire at grenfell tower in london , andy hickmott , the chief fire officer said whilst this is a `` horrific incident , this type of fire is extremely rare '' .
the service had made contact with all local authorities in warwickshire , he said , to offer additional guidance .

documents.title: music day : blue plaque for nick drake
text: over the last few weeks we 've been asking you to nominate any local music legends you feel deserve an official blue plaque .
here in the west midlands you 've chosen is nick drake who was brought up in tanworth-in-arden near solihull and died at the age of 26 in 1974 .
his music only really became famous after he died and the likes of rem , kate bush and paul weller have all said his music has been a massive influence them .
author: Louise Brierley
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man threatens staff with imitation firearm in post office robbery
text: a man has threatened staff at a post office in coventry with an imitation hand gun .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: travellers wreak havoc at a warwick football club
text: members of central ajax football club have been cleaning up the destruction left by travellers who set up camp at the hampton road on tuesday night .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: community raises £ 5,000 for stab victim 's funeral
text: more than £ 5,000 has been raised for the funeral of a man who died after he was stabbed at a coventry petrol station .
tattoo artist mark nesmith was found with stab wounds at a bp garage on butts road in coventry on sunday .
a fundraising page , set up on tuesday by his former employers , grizzly art collective and hales street studio has just reached the £ 5,000 mark .
in a statement they said `` not only was he an employee and colleague he was family to us all '' .

documents.title: coventry city court date confirmed for legal battle over sale of ricoh arena to wasps
text: coventry city have a pre-season fixture in court after the date was confirmed for a fresh legal battle being pursued by ccfc owners sisu against coventry city council .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: pupil had 'change of heart ' after taking loaded gun to school
text: a court heard how a nuneaton schoolboy , who admitted taking a loaded shotgun to school , also took ear plugs and a lock-knife with him to the school after removing the shotgun from a secure cabinet belonging to a relative .
prosecutor omar majid said the shotgun and ammunition was legally held by an adult known to the boy .
mr majid told the court the boy had gone into a room at the school and taken out the items , but had a `` change of heart '' and decided to call police , confirming the gun was loaded .
`` he said 'i do n't know why i 've got it , i just felt so angry this morning and i had to get it out ' , mr majid said .

text: 'one punch ' street killer jailed

documents.title: three-vehicle collision closes a5
text: the a5 , near rugby , is closed in both directions between the a426 ( cosford ) and the a428 ( crick ) due to a collision involving a car , motorbike and lorry .
# a5 remains closed in both directions between the # a426 and the # a428 near # rugby .

documents.title: analysis : m6 toll sold to investment firm
text: the m6 toll has been sold to a company called ifm .
it already owns manchester airports group , anglian water and arqiva - which run the transmitters used for bbc broadcasts .
ownership of the m6 toll has passed from one australian company to another .
now it 's a group of pension funds that sees the road as a good investment .
despite the losses of previous year , ifm sees it not only as a viable asset , but a profitable one too .
losses of the past happened mainly because of a huge mortgage needed to pay for the construction of the road .
following restructuring , in recent years , and the latest sale of the road , that mortgage has effectively been wiped away , clearing the way for the m6 toll to finally make a profit .
growth in traffic and more roadworks on the midlands motorways can only add to the profit potential .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cyclist treated for head injuries after kenilworth crash
text: a cyclist is being treated for head injuries and face wounds after a collision in kenilworth last night .
the ambulance service say they were called at around 18:00 at the junction of bridge street and new street .
it said the cyclist , who was n't wearing a helmet , was taken to coventry 's university hospital .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: loss-making m6 toll motorway sold
text: loss-making m6 toll motorway sold

documents.title: two more charged over coventry stabbing
text: two more charged over coventry stabbing

documents.title: fears that children 's centres across nuneaton and bedworth are at risk
text: cherished children 's centres across nuneaton and bedworth could be under threat as plans have been revealed to shake up the service .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: breakingtwo more charged over murder of mark nesmith
text: detectives have charged two more people with the murder of mark nesmith at a coventry petrol station .
the 35-year-old tattoo artist died in hospital after being stabbed at a bp garage in the butts , coventry on sunday .
uzair hussain , 24 from crampers field radford and 18-year-old sebastian vastaki-barsby from barkers butts lane in coundon are both set to appear at coventry magistrates today charged with murder .
a total of three people have now been charged in connection with the murder .

documents.title: m6 toll road has been sold
text: the bbc has learned that the m6 toll has been sold .
the road , which bypasses the most congested parts of the m6 , was put up for sale by its australian owners last year .
the new owner is an investment group called ifm , which is owned by several pension funds .
ifm already runs a number of toll roads around the world and has some other big investments in the uk .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: boy admits taking loaded shotgun to nuneaton school
text: a teenage boy who took a loaded shotgun , 200 rounds of ammunition and a mask into a school has admitted possessing the weapon with intent to endanger life , a court heard .
the 15-year-old told a 999 call handler he had `` a change of heart '' and had been thinking of harming others .
police arrested the boy after being called to higham lane school in nuneaton on tuesday .
he has been bailed for sentencing at warwick crown court next month .

documents.title: security arrangement at edgbaston ahead of india v bangladesh
text: security will be stepped up for today 's champions trophy semi-final match at edgbaston .
the game between india and bangladesh is a sell out .
all the spectators will have their bags searched on the way in .
warwickshire 's chief executive neil snowball says the security arrangements for the tournament have worked well so far :
we remain extremely vigilant , we 're not taking anything for granted at all , we 're still on the highest level of security here all around the stadium .
we 'll have full searches and are encouraging all spectators who are fortunate enough to have a ticket to get here in plenty of time .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright start there 's the possibility of some light showers around lunchtime , before a warm and sunny afternoon .
the pollen count is expected to be very high and top temperatures expected of 20c ( 68f ) .

text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday , but keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: millionaire donates £ 1,000 to coventry baby 's funeral
text: a controversial millionaire landlord has donated £ 1,000 to help fund the funeral of coventry baby kassadie-maria conway .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: man held over £ 500k heroin seizure at airport
text: a dutch man living in coventry has been remanded in custody after border force officers found heroin worth more than £ 500,000 in a suitcase at heathrow airport .
the discovery was made after the passenger was stopped on sunday upon arriving on a flight from addis ababa in ethiopia .
fidele rugonumugabo , 42 , has been charged with importing a class a drug .
he appeared at uxbridge magistrates court on monday and has been detained until his next appearance at isleworth crown court in july .
author: Liz Saul
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: education bosses call for a review at a nuneaton school after shotgun drama
text: education bosses have called for a review at the nuneaton school at the centre of the shotgun drama .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: coventry charity set for funding boost 'bonus '
text: a coventry charity is set to receive more than £ 200,000 of funding .
coventry cyrenians is among 257 projects sharing more than £ 5m of lottery money .
the charity supports vulnerable people in the city to rebuild their lives .
a grant of that size is always a huge pleasure to hear about and obviously for the service and for the city it 's a real bonus . ''

documents.title: weather : another muggy night followed by some cloud
text: we 're expecting another muggy night , but it should be a bit cooler tomorrow , with more cloud around .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: baker honours coventry music star with 'blue plaque ' cake
text: the work of a groundbreaking composer from coventry is being celebrated as part of an annual bbc event .
delia derbyshire , who wrote the dr who theme song , is so be memorialised with a blue plaque at her childhood home in the city as part of bbc music day this thursday .
the electronic music pioneer has also inspired leamington baker jenny hudson to bake a cake in her honour .
author: Vic Minett
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: stratford college looks forward to bright future after securing merger deal
text: stratford college is looking forward to a bright future after securing a merger deal .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: witness appeal after biker dies in warwickshire
text: a motorcyclist has been killed in a collision involving two vehicles , police say .
it happened just before 10:00 on saturday on the b4451 between southam and deppers
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: travellers ordered to leave warwickshire site
text: a group of travellers have been ordered to leave a site in warwick , police say .
officers were called on tuesday morning to reports of an encampment at the central ajax football club .
the force says it has now issued a section 61 notice to the travelling community to instruct them to vacate the land on thursday .
incident : 439 of 13 june 2017 # warwick
good !
i think it 's a disgrace that gov .
does n't support immediate removal or arrest in these cases !
the damage left is awful !

documents.title: football : sky blues announce pre-season spain tour
text: coventry city has confirmed its heading to spain for a pre-season tour next month .
the side will fly out to the alicante region on sunday 9 july .
manager mark robins has lined up two fixtures overseas although the opposition and venues are yet to be confirmed .
it 's really important that we get everybody together in a different environment to prepare intensely for the season ahead .
it will be very competitive and a vital part of our preparation .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: man sentenced to six years in jail for manslaughter
text: a man has been jailed for six years after being found guilty of manslaughter , police say .
warwickshire police say vijay james masih , 31 , of brook road , willenhall , wolverhampton , threw a single punch at robert bavington , 29 , outside moo bar in leamington town centre last april .
mr bavington was taken to hospital after falling to the ground and hitting his head where he later died from his injuries .
masih denied the charge but was found guilty by unanimous verdict at warwick crown court , a statement released this afternoon says .

documents.title: nuneaton residents warned of water supply 'interruptions '
text: people in nuneaton are being warned of possible `` interruptions '' to their water supply due to a burst pipe at bagworth road .
customers in nuneaton may be experiencing supply interruptions .
we apologise for any inconvenience .
for info updates

documents.title: the fine margins of a hung parliament
text: the fine margins of a hung parliament
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: ribbon cut on 'world 's largest ' classic car factory
text: the biggest purpose-built car facility of its kind has now opened in warwickshire .
coventry-based jaguar land rover has cut the ribbon on its multi-million pound classic car factory at ryton .
workers will restore old jags and land rovers by hand using original parts .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: tower block operator reassures residents in the west midlands
text: a housing group that operates 40 tower blocks in coventry and birmingham has moved to reassure its residents following a huge blaze at a block of high-rise flats in west london .
whitefriars has insisted it has a `` very strict system '' in place to ensure `` customers ' safety '' .
it 's after at least six people died and dozens more were injured when a fire broke out at grenfell tower in the early hours of the morning .
all of our high-rise blocks have annual fire safety checks and any safety work identified is undertaken as a matter of priority .
we inspect all fire doors and communal areas weekly to ensure they working correctly and are free from rubbish . ''
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: midlands emergency services show their support for london
text: emergency services across the west midlands have posted messages of support for their colleagues in london dealing with the 24-storey tower block blaze .

phil loach , west midlands chief fire officer says : `` our commitment to preventing fires in people 's homes means the numbers of such incidents are significantly fewer , but these tragic events show that their severity and impact can still be major . ''
you can follow the latest developments on this story on a dedicated live page on bbc news .
horrific .
our hearts go out to the many victims .
thoughts and prayers with our colleagues at # grenfelltower
another tragic incident .
hope our brave firefighters return safely to station .
thoughts with all those affected .

fire fighters .
always do top job .
all round the country .

and to your boys and girls too .
every day an unseen and unappreciated public service

documents.title: tributes continue for london tower block blaze victims
text: the re-elected labour mp for coventry south has paid tribute to people who have been affected by a huge blaze at a block of flats in west london .
at least six people have died and dozens more hospitalised after the fire broke out at grenfell tower overnight .
my thoughts are with all those involved , and the emergency services , in the grenfell tower fire .

documents.title: colleagues pay tribute to coventry stab victim
text: a 35-year-old man who died of knife wounds in coventry has been described as `` very talented '' by his former colleagues .
mark nesmith was stabbed at the bp garage in the butts on sunday morning .
staff at his former workplace , grizzly art collective tattoo studio , have now begun fundraising to help cover the cost of his funeral .

not only did nessy have a passion for art and tattooing , he had a love of music which led him to play in a couple of bands it was an honour to work with this talented man over the years he worked at our studio .
he will always hold a big place in our hearts .

documents.title: britain - share your personal bests ! london 2017
text: this summer , london is hosting the biggest global sporting events of the year - the 2017 world athletics and para athletics championships - and the organisers have launched a scheme to get people involved in athletics right around the country .
it 's called team personal best and the idea is that local sports clubs or community groups across the uk sign up and put on events with an athletics theme .
it does n't have to be a track-and-field meet - it can be a fun run , family sports day , even an event screening or bake sale with activities .
there 's a list of suggestions on the teampb submission page , here .
event participants are then encouraged to share their athletic achievements - no matter how big or small - with the hashtag # teampersonalbest to build a nationwide buzz around the championships .
you can find events near you here and if you want more information about how to get started in athletics , check out our get inspired guide .

documents.title: hajj pilgrims warned about fraudulent travel agents
text: coventry trading standards is warning muslims in the city to be cautious of fraudulent travel agents when planning their hajj pilgrimage .
the annual religious event sees thousands of people venture to saudi arabia in august .
but travellers are being told to avoid falling for `` too good to be true '' offers when arranging their journeys .
hajj is one of the most significant events for the muslim community some people may find out their tour bookings were never made and the fraudsters have stolen their money .

documents.title: dr who theme tune composer honoured with plaque
text: the work of an electronic music pioneer from coventry is to be recognised with a blue plaque .
delia derbyshire , who wrote the dr who theme tune , will be memorialised at her childhood home in the city after bbc local radio listeners nominated her for the honour .
the plaque will be one of 47 unveiled on bbc music day this thursday .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: world 's largest classic car factory officially opens today
text: the biggest purpose-built car facility of its kind opens in warwickshire later .
coventry-based jaguar land rover cuts the ribbon on its new £ 7m classic car factory at ryton this afternoon .
workers will restore classic jags and land rovers using a kit of original parts .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: higham lane school head defends keeping parents in the dark over shotgun alert
text: the headteacher of a school where police seized a shotgun and ammunition on tuesday has moved to re-assure parents .
author: Birmingham Mail

documents.title: more tributes for grenfell tower victims
text: warwickshire fire and rescue service have paid tribute to the families and firefighters involved in the deadly fire at a tower block in west london .
six people are known to have died and dozens more have been injured after a fire broke out at grenfell tower in the early hours of the morning .
our thoughts are with everyone involved in the fire in london and our emergency service colleagues .
# grenfelltower

you did your best there and then some !

documents.title: breakingman remanded in custody over murder charge
text: a 21-year-old man from coventry charged with murder has been remanded in custody .
tyler smith , from attoxall road , is accused of killing 35-year-old mark nesmith near the bp garage in the butts on sunday morning .
he 's due at warwick crown court on thursday .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: tributes paid to victims of london fire
text: a coventry councillor has taken to twitter to pay tribute to those who have been caught up in a huge blaze at a block of flats in west london .
dozens more have been hospitalised after a fire broke out at grenfell tower overnight .

documents.title: warwickshire mp keeps government role
text: the re-elected conservative mp for nuneaton , arley and hartshill has announced he 's been reappointed as a parliamentary under-secretary in the department for communities and local government .
marcus jones has credited his success to the people in his constituency that supported him during last week 's general election .

many congrats and look forward to continuing to work with you going forward

documents.title: rugby : wasps star set for international debut
text: wasps ' flanker thomas young is set to play for wales for the first time on friday .
the 25-year-old is one of three uncapped players to be named in the squad that will face tonga in the first test in auckland .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: unemployment in west midlands rises as uk total falls
text: unemployment in the west midlands has risen , latest figures from the office for national statistics show , despite a fall nationally .
between february and april , there were 6,000 more unemployed people in the region than november to january , giving a total of 166,000 .
across the uk , for the same period , there were 50,000 fewer people out of work with 1.53 million unemployed .
the west midlands figure is also higher than the year before , with an increase of 6,000 compared with february to april 2016 .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tributes left at scene of coventry stabbing
text: flowers have been laid outside a coventry petrol station after a 35-year-old man died of knife wounds .
mark nesmith died in hospital after being stabbed at the bp garage in the butts , coventry on sunday .
tyler smith , 21 , of attoxhall road , has been charged with murder and is due to appear at coventry magistrates court later .

documents.title: classic car factory officially opens today
text: the largest purpose-built facility for classic cars in the world opens in warwickshire later .
coventry-based jaguar land rover cuts the ribbon on its new £ 7m factory at ryton where workers will restore classic jags and land rovers by hand using a kit of original parts .
we 'll bring you more updates and photos through the day as we get them .

BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

the singer was in the city as part of his 'heavy entertainment show ' uk tour .

text: man charged with tattoo artist 's murder

documents.title: boy charged with having shotgun at school
text: a teenager from nuneaton has been charged with possession of a firearm , ammunition and a blade at a school in the town .
officers were called to higham lane school at 9:15 yesterday , where the boy was arrested and a shotgun and ammunition seized .
he was also later found to be in possession of a pocket knife .
the boy has been detained and will appear at warwickshire magistrates ' court today .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: tony wadsworth : disgraced presenter may lose honorary degree
text: de montfort university has confirmed it is considering whether to strip disgraced bbc broadcaster tony wadsworth of an honorary degree given to him five years ago ,
wadsworth and his wife julie were jailed for five years on friday after being found guilty of a string of indecent assaults on under-age boys .

a spokesperson for the university said : `` following news of the verdict in this case , the university is now reviewing its award of an honorary degree made in 2012 , in accordance with its procedures . ''
the pair , who lived in broughton astley , worked for more than 20 years for bbc local radio in leicester and birmingham .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch the latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: the whole region will have another fine day with plenty of sunshine .
some fair weather cloud will develop during the afternoon but even then we will see a lot of the sun .
it will be significantly warmer than yesterday - highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingman charged with murder after petrol station stabbing
text: a 21-year-old man has been charged with the murder after a stabbing at a coventry petrol station .
mark nesmith , 35 , died in hospital after being stabbed at the bp garage in the butts , coventry on sunday .
tyler smith , of attoxhall road , coventry magistrates court later this morning

we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .

text: firm 's city move brings 300 jobs

text: tributes paid to stabbing victim , 35

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday , but keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: meeting over bmw pensions dispute
text: union bosses at bwm 's engine plant at hams hall in warwickshire meet today after workers rejected the firm 's latest offer to settle their on-going pensions dispute .
stoppages at the site and the firm 's other uk factories remain an option .
workers have already staged four walkouts during the dispute , which is over the closure of a final-salary pension scheme .
bmw said the offer was `` fair '' and it was disappointed at the ballot result .

documents.title: coventry office 'not a relocation ' says financial ombudsman
text: the financial ombudsman service says its move to friargate is n't a relocation , although in the short term there will be a small number of staff from their london office who will `` temporarily '' move to the city .
it says the office will employ a number of staff , possibly from the local area , to take on their work looking into complaints about ppi .

cllr jim o'boyle , in charge of regeneration for the city council , said : we are keen to ensure that our city continues to attract and retain big name employers , creating quality jobs for local people and contributing to the success of the wider region . ''

documents.title: british and irish lions beaten 23-22 by highlanders in dunedin
text: elliot daly 's late attempt at a match-winning penalty fell short as the british and irish lions were narrowly beaten by the highlanders in dunedin .
the wasps back came on as a second half replacement - and was just short on a 57-metre penalty that would have won the match .
it was a second loss in four games for warren gatland 's side in new zealand .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : a clear night and lots of sun tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a largely clear night and lots of sun tomorrow , with temperatures of up to 25c ( 77f ) in parts of the region .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: terror attacks hit visitor numbers , warwick castle owner says
text: the firm that owns warwick castle says visitor numbers have fallen since the terrorist attacks in manchester and london .

merlin entertainments , which owns madame tussauds and legoland , said group trading has been in line with expectations this year , adding that more than 70 % of 2016 profit was generated from outside the uk .
however , it said domestic demand had weakened in recent weeks and that it was `` cautious on trends in foreign visitation over the coming months '' .

documents.title: name emerges of man who died following stabbing
text: a man who died shortly after he was found stabbed at a service station in coventry has been named locally as tattoo artist mark nesmith , 35 .

a 21-year-old man arrested on sus of attempted murder prior to the death on monday remains in police custody , while a woman , aged 23 , arrested on sus of assisting an offender has been released on bail .

documents.title: school 'remains open as normal ' after firearms arrest
text: higham lane school in nuneaton said staff and police `` responded promptly '' to reports earlier today of a boy at the site with a gun .
a boy was arrested on sus of possession of a firearm , according to the warwickshire force which said a shotgun and ammunition were seized .

according to one parent , the school sent an initial text message saying `` although there was an incident this message is to reassure you that all students and staff are safe and the matter has been dealt with '' .
the school later sent another text that mentioned the arrest , adding `` police have confirmed they are happy for the school to remain open as normal '' .

documents.title: financial ombudsman revealed as new friargate tenant
text: a major national financial body is to move staff to the friargate development being built near coventry railway station , the city council has announced .
the financial ombudsman service is set to take two floors of the new building , accommodating up to 300 staff later this year .

in april , the royal institution of chartered surveyors announced it would no longer be relocating staff to the new building after the development `` did not materialise in the timescales originally envisaged '' .
friargate is to be a new 37-acre business district including 25 new buildings , 14 of which would be offices , according to its developers , along with two hotels , leisure developments and homes .

documents.title: police federation demands more investment
text: there are calls in the west midlands for the government to show commitment to re-investing in policing .
the west midlands police federation chairman tom cuddeford , who represents the force 's constables , sergeants and inspectors , says prime minister theresa may must act .
the time has come to halt these cuts and re-invest in policing - the safety of the public must be paramount .
we also need investment in equipment , such as taser , and technology to help police forces do the jobs they are entrusted to do by the public . ''

last week during the general election campaign , theresa may insisted the uk 's largest police force , the met police , was `` well-resourced '' as labour warned cuts to police numbers were a danger to the public .

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: teacher cycles to syria to help save lives
text: a teacher from warwick plans to cycle all the way to syria and back again to help save lives in the war-torn country .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: boy arrested after gun seized at school
text: boy arrested after gun seized at school

documents.title: family left 'petrified ' by school gun arrest
text: the grandparent of a child at higham lane school said the family had been left `` petrified '' by the firearms incident at the site earlier in which a boy was arrested and a `` shotgun '' seized .
she said the child 's mother had received a text message from the nuneaton school saying there had been an incident `` but they could n't tell her anything else '' .
`` that absolutely petrified her and she rang me to say 'could i find out anything ' ?
`` i tried the school and could n't get through so i called warwickshire police .
`` obviously we 've been absolutely petrified . ''
she added `` the way things are now in the world , everything comes to mind '' .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: children 's services 'need improvement '
text: children 's services 'need improvement '

documents.title: coventry developments backed by mayor
text: a £ 3.7m loan to coventry developers to secure to city centre sites is being backed by the west midlands mayor , andy street .
the authority 's collective investment fund has awarded the money to secure the locations for redevelopment .
the mayor says the sites will make a `` significant contribution '' to the economic growth of the city centre .

the former coventry telegraph site will bring something to the city that it does n't currently offer while the former national grid site is of a scale that it has the potential for a whole host of uses .
what is perhaps most encouraging is that these sites , derelict for so long , are now attracting investment and this undoubtedly demonstrates the rising confidence in coventry . ''

documents.title: staff assaulted in warwick shop raid
text: a gang of robbers assaulted a shop worker and demanded money from the safe at a shop in chase meadow square in warwick yesterday , police say .
the three offenders made off with cash , cigarettes and a handbag after the raid at the one stop at about 05:45 .
warwickshire police says it has stepped up patrols in the area .

documents.title: brandon stadium homes plan revealed - and it could be backed by coventry bees campaigners
text: the owner of brandon stadium has revealed it is poised to unveil proposals to build houses on the site of what was coventry bees ' home track .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: council ca n't rule out another case like daniel pelka
text: coventry 's council leaders have been responding to ofsted findings that the city 's children 's services `` require improvement '' .
labour leader george duggins said the council was `` starting from a low base '' but he is `` satisfied '' it 's `` making the kind of progress it needs to '' .
he admitted the council did not make quick enough progress following an `` inadequate '' ofsted rating three years ago , saying `` i think for a while we treaded water '' .
mr duggins was cabinet member responsible for children 's services at the time of the last ofsted inspection , which came after the murder of four-year-old daniel pelka .
mr duggins added that despite the council 's best attempts , `` we ca n't absolutely guarantee that there will never be another daniel pelka in coventry , and nor can anybody else '' .

council chief executive martin reeves said that the death of daniel pelka was the `` toughest time '' in the council 's history and the legacy of the little boy would be in the drive to improve services .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: police remain in school after gun arrest
text: warwickshire police says it will have officers at a nuneaton school for the rest of the day to `` provide reassurance '' after a firearms incident there .
a boy was arrested when officers were called to higham lane school at 09:15 .

supt david gardner said the force would now carry out inquiries `` to establish exactly what happened and address any issues around the firearm '' , which , he said was a shotgun and seized along with ammunition .

documents.title: teenager arrested over school gun scare
text: a teenage boy has been arrested , and a firearm seized , after an incident at higham lane school in nuneaton , police say .
the warwickshire force said its officers responded to reports at about 09:15 that a boy was in possession of a firearm on the school site .
supt david gardner said a boy was `` quickly isolated '' to ensure `` there was no risk to pupils and staff '' .
`` we have seized a shotgun and ammunition '' , he said , adding : `` the initial report was received from the suspect himself . ''

documents.title: m6 delays after collision
text: delays are building on the m6 northbound after a crash on a stretch between junctions 3 and 3a , says highways england .
lane 3 closed # m6 northbound between j3 and j3a .
we are making to assist .
please appoach with care , delays building
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: coventry 's beleaguered children 's services 'require improvement '
text: services for children in coventry are no longer rated as `` inadequate '' but still `` require improvement '' to be good , according to ofsted .

the inspection report notes a `` historical legacy of weak practice '' , with the result for some children being too long a time taken to improve their outcomes - further delayed , it says , by `` poor-quality interventions '' .
safeguarding arrangements for privately fostered children were found to be `` poor '' , with the council `` not meeting its statutory duties in this area '' .
improvements were found in the response rates for children who needed immediate protection and services for care leavers and children with disabilities were rated as `` good '' .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: fears for warwickshire 's wildlife as works on the hs2 get under way
text: fears have been raised for the future of wildlife in warwickshire as work gets under way on hs2
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: coventry stabbing : woman released on bail
text: police investigating the death of a 35-year-old man found with stab injuries at a petrol station on butts road , coventry , have released a 23-year-old woman on bail .
she was arrested yesterday on sus of assisting an offender .
detectives say a 21-year-old man - arrested on monday on sus of attempted murder prior to the injured man 's death - remains in custody .

text: 'old-fashioned handshake ' now for stone

documents.title: former nightclub rio 's demolished to make way for homes
text: a former nightclub which was the oldest in the town has been reduced to rubble to make way for huge flats .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: travel advice for robbie williams fans
text: ticket holders for robbie williams at the ricoh tonight are being advised to travel to coventry station where buses are being provided by the event organisers .

customers are not recommended to travel by train to coventry arena station , due to the limited capacity , and london midland says the station will be closed after the concert , with no trains stopping there .

documents.title: investigation launched into bedworth attack
text: a man assaulted in bedworth in the early hours of sunday morning was attacked by two men possibly using golf clubs and a bottle , police say .
it happened around bellairs avenue , katherine avenue and potters road at about 04:13 .
the victim was taken to hospital with injuries to his head .
police arrested a 29-year-old man from nuneaton on sus of assault , who has now been released under investigation .

documents.title: teen admits stabbing a man during a violent clash in a bedworth park
text: a youth who stabbed a man in the back during a violent clash in bedworth 's miners welfare park has finally admitted being responsible .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: rail services delayed through nuneaton
text: a vehicle striking a bridge at hinckley is affecting rail services between hinckley and nuneaton .
the line was closed for a time , but has just re-opened says cross country trains .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: coventry schemes awarded £ 3.7m by combined authority
text: two city centre projects in coventry have been awarded a £ 3.7m loan by the west midlands combined authority .

complex development projects ltd ( cdp ) says the investment will allow it to secure two key sites , including the former coventry evening telegraph offices as well as land to the rear of the building .
the £ 2.820m loan , it said , would bring forward proposals to turn the former newspaper offices in corporation street into a boutique hotel along with residential units .
the other award of £ 960,000 is for the acquisition of the former national grid gas works in abbotts lane - a 5.5 acre site opposite belgrage plaza .

documents.title: plans for country 's first nature school in nuneaton delayed by general election
text: it is hoped that camp hill could be home to the country 's first nature school but it 's now set to be later than expected .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: jaguar land rover invests in lyft - report
text: jaguar land rover has made a £ 25m investment in the minicab-hailing service lyft , according to the times today .
the investment comes from the coventry company 's venture capital unit , inmotion ventures .
lyft is raising money to help compete with bigger rival uber .
last year it received investment from general motors .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: video : therapy dogs 'transform lives '
text: two trained 'therapy ' dogs are `` helping transform the lives '' of people with mental health difficulties in coventry and warwickshire , a charity claims .
coventry and warwickshire mind said the alaskan malamutes mishka and koda ( are `` star attractions '' at sessions helping people to relax and manage their anxiety in radford , coventry .
the dogs are part of the national scheme , sled dogs as therapy uk .
author: Marian McNamee
Reporter, BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : overnight weather forecast
text: it will be a dry evening , with some clear spells and winds continuing to ease .
however , cloud will increase from the west overnight to bring some light rain later , mainly in the north .
tomorrow , will be mostly dry and bright after patchy rain clears in the morning .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: man found with stab wounds dies
text: man found with stab wounds dies

documents.title: coventry stab victim dies
text: a man found with serious stab wounds in a car park in earlsdon , coventry , has died .
the 35-year-old was taken to hospital after being found in the car park of the bp garage on butts road , in the early hours of sunday but died this afternoon , police said .
the incident is now being treated as a murder investigation , said west midlands police , who earlier arrested two people in connection with the stabbing .

documents.title: bmw disappointed after 'fair ' offer rejected
text: car giant bmw says it is `` disappointed '' unite members have rejected the company 's `` best offer '' aimed at resolving a long-running dispute over pensions .
a spokesman said the offer was designed to support employees during the proposed move to new pension arrangements .
we believe the offer , which resulted from lengthy negotiations with the union since september last year , was fair .
it was designed to improve competitiveness , which is in the long-term interests of all our employees in the future . ''
he added the firm would be discussing the `` next steps '' with unite .
a total of 56.6 % of unite members based at plants in west midlands ' hams hall , swindon , and cowley , near chichester , turned down the offer by 56.6 % .

documents.title: errol christie 's career
text: christie is in the guinness book of records for winning 10 british amateur titles .
his final professional fight record stands at 41 - 32 wins , eight defeats and one draw .
he split £ 82,500 with mark kaylor for their 1985 fight at wembley arena - a record for a non-title fight at the time .
his last fight was in 1993 at the free trade hall in manchester where he lost to trevor ambrose in the second round .
during this career , he was itv 's main boxing attraction , often in publicity shots with the stars of the channel 's light-entertainment shows .
there is a famous of hundreds of itv stars and at the back , topless and waving a union flag , is errol .
after retiring , he sold baby clothes at lewisham market .
author: Steve Bunce
Boxing pundit

documents.title: rugby council website applauded as example of best practice
text: rugby borough council 's website was commended for its accessibility for the second year running and hailed as an example of best practice .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: cyclist 'dragged along road under lorry '
text: cyclist 'dragged along road under lorry '

documents.title: kenilworth station costs likely to go up by £ 373,000
text: the cost to build kenilworth station is likely to go up by £ 373,000 , warwickshire county council has confirmed .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: driver 'mowed down cyclist before driving off to complete delivery ' , jury told
text: a nuneaton lorry driver hit and killed a 25-year-old cyclist , dragged her 14 metres under his wheels , then drove off to complete his delivery , a jury has been told .
darren anderton , 49 , denies causing the death of magda tadaj by careless driving .
jurors at the old bailey were told he had left his base in coventry at about 04:00 and driven about 140 miles before the crash in st james 's road , croydon , south london .
prosecutor ian mcloughlin told the court mr anderton left the injured woman lying in the road for around eight minutes until paramedics arrived , before driving off to complete his delivery .

documents.title: tamsin greenway : wasps netball win 'pretty special '
text: wasps director of netball and head coach tamsin greenway played a full game at wing-attack in their superleague-winning game - having retired in 2015 .
the former england international has now won three consecutive titles , having led surrey storm to back-to-back victories in 2015 and 2016 .
she said : `` this one is pretty special .
i do n't usually get emotional but the last 10 months has been absolute madness .
`` to get on court , to prove i can still do it and to have the team accept me play was pretty special . ''

documents.title: family pay tribute to 'kind and special ' errol christie
text: a statement from the family of errol christie describes the former boxer as a `` kind and special man '' who was `` loved by so many '' .
it says his last few days were spent with his son , who cared for him `` throughout this hard period '' .
chris eubank was among many who paid tribute to the former boxer , who 's died .
errol christie one of the old masters of boxing has passed away .
i sparred with him many times in our early 20s & he was a sweetheart rip
the most gifted boxer .
how he never even fought for a world title ! !
a travesty , but those who saw him have sweet memories !
rip
sorry to hear this , i know he did a lot of work in the wider community .
how are you doing sir my name is cedric watson and im a high school student and im on my way to college i want to dress like u can u help me
yellow swim shorts you be cushty
very sad news.a great fighter.went on to become a stand up

great fighter , fond memories rip

documents.title: hung parliament sinks business confidence , iod finds
text: the uncertainty caused by the general election has led business confidence to sink `` through the floor '' , according to a lobby group .
a snap poll of 700 members of the institute of directors ( iod ) found a `` dramatic drop '' in confidence following the hung parliament .
julie white - the boss of coventry-based construction contractors d-drill - told the bbc - no one in her industry 's impressed with what 's happened .
construction does n't like it because people stop building people stop investing .
so now we really need the government to re-build itself quickly and to invest back into industry and to lead our country forward .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: zahawi : 'right policies but we did n't sell them '
text: the conservative mp for stratford-on-avon , nadhim zahawi , says the party 's election manifesto policies were right , but the party neglected to sell them sufficiently .
in a post on conservativehome.com he writes that the manifesto contained a `` good and hopeful '' platform for government and the party must not now `` retreat backwards '' .
`` we were damaged by the social care policy and how poorly it was initially explained , '' he said .
`` but we were also damaged by failing to focus enough on the positive policies that we had - the reasons to vote conservative , rather than just the reasons not to vote labour . ''

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today : political uncertainty 'disastrous ' for economy
text: businesses in the west midlands have described the general election as a `` big disappointment '' as the government heads towards brexit negotiations .
a snap poll of 700 members of the institute of directors found a `` dramatic drop '' in confidence following the hung parliament .
there 's a concern the political uncertainty could be `` disastrous '' for the economy .
our reporter ben godfrey has been to one company in the black country to gauge reaction and will have more on bbc1 from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: fire service using your phones as eyes
text: fire service using your phones as eyes

documents.title: tributes to 'old master ' boxing champ
text: tributes to 'old master ' boxing champ

documents.title: bmw staff reject pension offer
text: a bruising dispute between bmw and its british workers looks set to continue .
staff have rejected the latest pension deal from the company and union officials will meet on tuesday to discuss what to do next .
unite national officer fred hanna said the union had not recommended the offer has `` it would have different outcomes for different people and their pensions '' .
`` we would urge bmw bosses to reflect on the result and listen to the workforce by further engaging in meaningful talks with unite , '' he said .
bmw wants to close the final salary pension scheme and is offering a cash payment into a new scheme as compensation .
there have already been four walkouts over the dispute , including at the hams hall plant in warwickshire .
three 24-hour strikes scheduled for may were suspended while staff considered the deal .

documents.title: pensions offer rejected in bmw dispute
text: pensions offer rejected in bmw dispute

documents.title: kidney transplant athlete prepares for world championships
text: kidney transplant patient declan logue would not have imagined 18 years ago that he would be preparing for a world championship .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: plans for a46 link road unveiled
text: details of the a46 link road scheme have been unveiled by warwickshire county council .
the 10-year scheme is formed of three phases , designed to ease congestion and improve access to the university of warwick and stoneleigh park .
details of the scheme can be found on a new dedicated website .

documents.title: errol christie : still holds amateur title record
text: errol christie , who had died aged 54 , has a place in the guinness book of records as the only british boxer to win 10 amateur titles .
christie , seen here in a bout with mark kayor in 1990 , captained england in amateur boxing between 1980 -83 .
the coventry ex-boxer was diagnosed with cancer in march 2015 , and died on sunday .
barry mcguigan said : `` so sad to hear the news that the hugely talented errol christie has passed away , god bless you errol rip deepest sympathies to his family . ''

documents.title: 'record crowds ' for women 's tour through warwickshire
text: the women 's tour , which went past warwick 's lord leycester hospital ( attracted more spectators in warwickshire than the event last year , says the county council .
thousands lined the streets to watch the third stage of the race , which saw britain 's alice barnes beaten in a sprint finish by australian chloe hosking in leamington spa .
around 75,000 turned out to watch the riders last year , and the council said early estimates suggested even more watched this year .
britain 's hannah barnes finished third as poland 's katarzyna niewiadoma claimed the overall title after sunday 's final stage in london .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: community united at leamington mosque in fight against extremism
text: an appeal to the community to stand together and tackle the threat of extremism helped pack leamington 's baitul ehsan mosque on sunday night .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: netball superleague : wasps beat loughborough lightning in grand final
text: wasps have won the superleague title in their debut season , beating loughborough lightning 55-51 in sunday 's grand final in birmingham .
the coventry-based team were one of three new franchises this season .
they led by one goal at the start of the final quarter , having dominated loughborough in the mid-court .
their attacking combination of rachel dunn and natalie haythornthwaite proved too strong for regular-season winners loughborough .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: homeless man handed a new chance in life
text: a former homeless man has been given a chance at a new career as a cycle mechanic .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: high or very high pollen levels forecast this week
text: watch out hayfever sufferers - it 's not going to be a good week in general as the pollen levels look to be between high and very high for most of the uk .
you can check the latest levels at any time by going to the bbc weather website and then selecting your area of the country .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: two arrested after coventry stabbing
text: two people have been arrested after a man was stabbed in the spon end area of coventry , police say .

a 35-year-old local man is in a critical condition in hospital after being found with serious injuries on the car park of the bp service station on butts road in the early hours of yesterday morning .
a 21-year-old man from coventry has been arrested on sus of attempted murder and a 23-year-old woman has been detained on sus of assisting an offender .
forensic examinations of the scene are continuing , the force said .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: former boxer errol christie dies
text: former coventry boxing champion errol christie has died from cancer aged 54 , his footballer nephew cyrus has announced on twitter .
the ex-middleweight , who was european champion in 1983 , had been battling the disease the past two years .
his nephew , former sky blues player cyrus christie tweeted `` rip champ legends never die heart is broken rest in paradise uncle your not in pain anymore till we meet again . ''
tributes to the fighter were also tweeted from frank bruno , chris eubank and barry mcguigan .

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning from the coventry newsroom .
we 'll be bringing you reaction to the general election results around coventry and warwickshire along with the news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
let us know what is going on in your area or send us your photos .
you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Vanessa Pearce
